conclusion: Apply principles of mechanics, law of moments, and conservation of energy.
Setup involves child sliding down rope attached to ball on guide rail, angle β constant.
Identify given quantities: mass of pillow m1, mass of child m2, angle β.
Tension in rope equals weight of ball, m1 * g.
Force exerted by pillow on child is m2 * g.
Using law of moments: m1 * g * sin β = m2 * g.
Solve for ratio of tension to force: (m1 * g * sin β) / (m2 * g).
Since sin β = height of child / length of guide rail, ratio becomes m1 / m2.
Ratio of tension of rope to force exerted by pillow on child is 1/2.
